content.text:
# Battle of Ayacucho order of battle

The order of battle for the Battle of Ayacucho proceeded as follows:
Commander in Chief
* Antonio José de Sucre
Officers
· Chief of Staff (military) Agustín Gamarra · First Aide de Camp Francis Burdett O'Connor ·
Division of Perú (Left), Commander of division José de La Mar
*  1st Infantry Battalion, Commander Francisco de Paula Otero
*  2nd Infantry Battalion (Trujillo), Commander Ramón Gonzales
*  3rd Infantry Battalion(Callao), Commander Miguel Benavides
*  Peruvian Legion of the Guard Infantry Battalion, Commander José María Plaza
1st Colombian Division (Reserve), Commander of division Jacinto Lara
*  Vencedor Battalion, Commander Ignacio Luque
*  Vargas Battalion, Commander Trinidad Moran
*  Rifles Battalion, Commander Arthur Sandes
2nd Colombian Division (Right), Commander of division José María Córdoba
*  Bogotá Btn., Commander Leon Galindo
*  Voltigeurs Battalion, Commander Pedro Guash
*  Pichincha Battalion, Commander Manuel Leon
*  Caracas Battalion, Commander José Leal
Cavalry Division, Commander of division William Miller
*      2 Squadrons from Junin Hussars, Commander Isodoro Suárez
*   1 Squadron from the Regiment of Mounted Grenadiers, Commander Alexis Bruix
*    2 Squadrons of the Gran Colombia Horse Grenadiers, Commander Lucas Carvajal
*      2 Squadrons, Colombian Hussars, Commander José Laurencio Silva
| col2 =
Commander in Chief
* José de La Serna
Chief of Staff
* José de Canterac
Division of Valdés
*  Cantabria Battalion; Commander: Antonio Tur, men: 580
*  "del Centro" Battalion (Azángaro); Commander: Felipe Rivero, men: 464
*  Voluntarios de Castro of Chiloe Battalion; Commander:  José Hugue, plazas:  men 495
*  1st "Imperial Alejandro" Battalion (Extremadura); Commander: Pedro Becerra, men: 398
Division of Monet
*  2nd Battalion, 1st Cusco Infantry Regiment; Commander: Francisco Villabase, men: 414
*  Burgos Battalion; Commander: Juan A. Pardo, men: 540
*  Guías del General Battalion; Commander: Joaquín Bolívar, plazas: 240
*  Victoria Battalion (Talavera); Commander: Manuel Sánchez, men: 392
*  Infante Don Carlos Battalion; Commander: Mariano Cucalón, men: 444
Division of González Villalobos
*  Gerona Battalion; Commander: Domingo Echezarraga, men: 900
*  1st Battalion, 1st Cusco Infantry Regiment; Commander: Joaquín Rubín de Celis, men: 415
*  Ferdinand VII Battalion (Buenos Aires); Commander: José Carratala, men: 196
Cavalry Division Ferraz
*  Guard Grenadiers Squadron, squadron commander: Valentín Ferraz, men: 380
*  '''Ferdinand VII's Hussars Squadron, Commander: Francisco Puyol, men: 124
*  Unión Dragoons Squadron, Commander: Ramón Gómez de Bedoya, men: 218
*  Peru Dragoons Squadron, Commander: Dionisio Marcilla, men: 146
*  Viceroy's Halberdiers''' Squadron; men: 46
}}
